name: places/ChIJ_xQXuo9ZwokR9FSJ9pAKQ9I
adrFormatAddress: 665 Broadway # 402, New York, NY 10012, USA

originalText.text:
I have applied for several jobs to companies that use Harri as as their recruiter. My education and experience matches the job description - yet Harri has turned down EVERY SINGLE application.
They have never offered to interview me to see if I might just be the perfect fit for any company they represent.
The below is an excerpt from one rejection from Aug 2021 -

"Unfortunately after careful deliberation we will not be progressing with your application any further.

We have had an excellent response to our advertising activity and we felt that other candidates better suited our current requirements for this role."

How does Harri carefully deliberate, without ever even trying to have an initial discussion with me? A piece of paper never tells it all.

I have been applying for years and been rejected. I just applied for another job on Indeed and my heart sank after I submitted and realized that Harri is the recruiter.

Harri, are you properly representing your clients when you repeatedly reject every single application I submit? Don't you think that arranging a 30 minute interview with me would help?

Very discouraging when I see the name Harri....I await the rejection...

originalText.text: Applied for a job via Harri. I decided  not to proceed with the interview. I then had an email cancelling the interview I had already cancelled, after the date and time. Then I got an email thanking me for attending (which I had not), and how great it was to meet me (which they didn't) but sadly that they didn't feel my experience suited the role (which was not the actual one I had applied for!) Apocalyptic incompetence: I just looked at another job vacancy and because it was via Harri I decided not to apply!

originalText.text:
charged us, took us several days to speak to someone as the platform didnt let us publish an ad we paid for.
Apparently, after a week waiting, the ad was published but no one ever applied.

originalText.text: poor customer service, no one able to cancel a membership once you realize the poor performance of their service. Only pulls from NY city, so even as close as Philly its ineffective. No thank you, much better alternatives available.

originalText.text: Not all employers use Harri. Unreliable for job searching. Great Concept though.
